hotspots.label: Large Compound Eyes
hotspots.fact: Dragonflies have huge eyes that help them see in many directions at once! These eyes are made up of thousands of tiny lenses, which helps them spot moving insects to eat. This is called **adaptation** — a special body feature that helps an animal survive in its environment.

vocabulary.definition: A special feature or behavior that helps an animal or plant survive and do well in its home.

hotspots.label: Segmented Body
hotspots.fact: A dragonfly's body is divided into three main parts: the head, thorax (middle), and abdomen (tail). Each part has a different job to help the dragonfly live and move. These sections are called **segments** — separate body parts that work together.

vocabulary.definition: Separate body sections that are connected together, like the rings on a caterpillar.

hotspots.label: Transparent Wings
hotspots.fact: Dragonfly wings are thin and clear, made of a special material that lets light pass through! These wings help dragonflies fly super fast and turn quickly to catch other insects. This is an important **body structure** that helps dragonflies hunt for food and escape danger.

vocabulary.definition: The different parts of an animal's body and how they are organized to help the animal live.

hotspots.label: Gray Textured Surface (Habitat)
hotspots.fact: This dragonfly is resting on a rough, gray surface like concrete or stone — a place where it might hunt or hide. Dragonflies live near water where they lay their eggs, but they can be found on many different surfaces. The place where an animal lives is called its **habitat** — all the things it needs to survive.

vocabulary.definition: The home of an animal or plant, including everything it needs like food, water, and shelter.
